channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Drain collapsing due to traffic. Station Road, 2nd December
item.description:
Drain is collapsing and is full of mud in Station Road close to old folks flats not far from the High Street junction. Most probably due to numerous heavy electric buses and cars constantly going over it and resting on it while the traffic lights are red.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2-6, Station Road, Longlands, Sidcup, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cuttings to be collected/flytipped items to be collected, 2nd December
item.description:
Please can these cuttings be collected. We have moved and piled them near to the wooden hut so that you don’t have to drive into the park. We also found some wood and wire that had been dumped in the park behind the composters, so have put it here as well.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rochester Avenue, Widmore, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped van with no tax or MOT, 2nd December
item.description:
I reported this before on here and it was closed without being resolved. Someone else has also reported it on here since you closed my report. The van is still there. It has obviously been dumped and has no tax or MOT. It now has flat tyres as it has been there so long and has graffiti on it. It is an eyesore. Please arrange for it to be removed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lovel Avenue, East Wickham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pathway needs repairing, 2nd December
item.description:
The main pathway is muddy and boggy. For the last four weeks wheelchair users have been unable to get into the park, then the people with young children and prams and now, dog walkers have stopped walking around the park due to the muddy ruts. IdVerde won’t drive in the park now either. I never thought I’d ask this, but please can type 1 aggregate be put down and whacked down along this path so that it’s acceptable for everyone. What 3 Words: Hello. Maybe. Milky Margin. Enter. Offer Discouraged. Thigh. Think Trim. Manage. Herb. Snacks. Spits. Movie Pile. Couple. Craft Twice. Scary. Mining Prone. Clock. Cafe Many thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Chase, Widmore, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping a mixture of rubbish, 2nd December
item.description:
This site is getting worse day by day. People are adding bags, boxes and a mattress. This is now a hazard and has been for over two weeks. This is the bin site at the end of Gaywood Street, SE1 6HG next to the sheltered accommodation. This is close to where my parents live. Sites like this attract mice and rats and need to cleared.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elephant and Castle, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The last lamp post of Kingsley Road on the side of Priory Park Road, 2nd December
item.description:
The lamp post has been off for a month now leaving the end of the road completely in the dark. This has instigated even more fly-tipping. The column should be number 06.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Priory Park Road, London

item.title: Works on the road for the last 4 weeks, 2nd December
